meanings.sent1: She tentered the fabric carefully to make sure it was flat.
meanings.sent2: The cat tentered its body across the warm sunlit spot on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The chef tentered the dough, making sure it covered the entire baking sheet.
meanings.sent4: The vines tentered across the garden, reaching out in all directions.
meanings.sent5: The painter tentered the colors on the canvas, creating a beautiful landscape.

meanings.definition: To be in a state of tension or strain
meanings.sent1: He tentered as he waited for the exam results to be announced.
meanings.sent2: The rope tentered under the weight of the heavy load it was carrying.
meanings.sent3: The actor tentered before going on stage, feeling nervous but excited.
meanings.sent4: The relationship tentered as they faced their first big disagreement.
meanings.sent5: The bridge tentered under the pressure of the rushing river below.

meanings.definition: To be on guard or watchful
meanings.sent1: The security guard tentered the entrance, keeping a close eye on everyone entering.
meanings.sent2: The dog tentered at the sound of footsteps approaching the house.
meanings.sent3: The owl tentered in the tree, scanning the darkness for any movement.
meanings.sent4: The soldier tentered the border, ready to defend the country if needed.
meanings.sent5: The lifeguard tentered the pool, ensuring the safety of all swimmers.
